com.github.i49.hibiscus.formats

Interface Format<V extends JsonValue>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - the type of JsonValue to be validated against this format.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    StringFormat
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsoluteURIFormat, DateTimeFormat, EmailFormat, HostFormat, HostnameFormat, Inet4AddressFormat, Inet6AddressFormat, URIFormat

    public interface Format<V extends JsonValue>
    Common interface to be implemented by all format classes.

    A format is one of restrictions on the value spaces of the types. Types in schema can select a format from predefined ones such as email address or IPv4 address. This makes it unnecessary to write complex regular expressions matching email address or IPv4 address. Most formats defined here are described by authoritative parties and considered as standard.

    This package provides various kinds of format implementations, and all these classes implement Format interface.

    These formats can be obtained by static methods of Formats class. Each format can be applied to the built-in types with help of FormatFacet, which is one of facets provided by com.github.i49.hibiscus.facets package. All formats currently available can be applied only to string() type.

    All currently supported formats are shown in Formats page.

    See Also:
    Formats

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getLocalizedName(Locale locale)
      Returns the format name which is appropriate to be displayed in specified locale.
      String getName()
      Returns the format name which must be unique in all formats.
      boolean matches(V jsonValue)
      Tests whether the given value matches this format and returns true if the value matches this format or otherwise returns false.

        String getName()
        Returns the format name which must be unique in all formats.
        Returns:
        the name of this format.
        See Also:

      • getLocalizedName

        String getLocalizedName(Locale locale)
        Returns the format name which is appropriate to be displayed in specified locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale for which the name will be localized.
        Returns:
        the localized name of this format.
        See Also:
        getName()

      • matches

        boolean matches(V jsonValue)
        Tests whether the given value matches this format and returns true if the value matches this format or otherwise returns false.
        Parameters:
        jsonValue - the JSON value to be tested whether it matches against this format or not.
        Returns:
        true if the input argument matches the format, otherwise false.
